snippet: The chief of Gawker Media, and king of traffic-trawling online journalism, sent a memo to the staff extolling the virtues of well-turned narratives and "authentic opinion."
abstract: The chief of Gawker Media, and king of traffic-trawling online journalism, sent a memo to the staff extolling the virtues of well-turned narratives and "authentic opinion."
lead_paragraph: Nick Denton, chief of Gawker Media, has been both praised and vilified for his relentless focus on user traffic in running Gawker, Deadspin, Jezebel, Lifehacker and other sites he owns. But in a year-in-review/preview message to his staff, Mr. Denton spends a fair amount of pixels on the pure virtues of well-turned narratives, traffic be damned. (He also opens with a quote from Steve Jobs, which seems surprisingly corporate and conventional, but Jobs-mania apparently has no bounds.)

headline.main: Nick Denton, Relentless Seeker of Online Traffic, Turns Sentimental About Writing
